channel.title: Question about the syntax highlight used. [Close]
channel.description:
I was just wondering which code syntax highlighter moparscape is using. Its an amazingly handy feature.
This can be closed, MITB answered my question.
[quote="Moparisthebest"][quote author=Advocatus link=action=profile;u=522217 date=1329824460] I was just wondering which code syntax highlighter moparscape (the site) is using. Its an amazingly handy feature. [/quote]
It's an open source PHP syntax highlighting library called GeSHI. :)[/quote]

item.title: Question about the syntax highlight used. [Close]
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Sorry for the gravedig, but does anyone have a version of Geshi compatible with SMF 1.1.16?

Read full topic

item.title: Question about the syntax highlight used. [Close]
item.dc:creator: @Advocatus Advocatus
item.description:
@Advocatus wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

might want to ask mitb directly in a PM as I recall GeshI was not compatible with the forums due to modifications.

Thanks I’ll send him a pm.

[quote=“Muroth, post:4, topic:433701”]/* Highlighted text - such as search results. */ .highlight { background-color: yellow; font-weight: bold; color: black; }

?[/quote]
Nou,yunodoitlikeme?

/* Highlighted text - such as search results. */ .highlight { background-color: yellow; font-weight: bold; color: black; }

Read full topic

item.title: Question about the syntax highlight used. [Close]
item.dc:creator: @Advocatus Advocatus
item.description:
@Advocatus wrote:

CoonHunter:

I just use notepad++, simple and efficient. Don’t need an IDE to run up my RAM usage

I meant the one on the forums…

Example:

public class HelloCoonHunter {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("Hello CoonHunter, welcome to Earth!");
    }

}

Read full topic
